member.name: T:StateleSSE.Abstractions.ISseBackplane
member.summary: Abstraction for a Server-Sent Events (SSE) backplane. Enables horizontal scaling by synchronizing events across multiple server instances. Implementations can use Redis, in-memory, RabbitMQ, or any other messaging system.

member.name: M:StateleSSE.Abstractions.ISseBackplane.Subscribe(System.String)
member.summary: Subscribe a local client (SSE connection) to a group. Returns a channel reader for receiving events and a unique subscriber ID.
member.returns: Tuple of channel reader and subscriber ID

member.name: M:StateleSSE.Abstractions.ISseBackplane.Unsubscribe(System.String,System.Guid)
member.summary: Unsubscribe a local client when the SSE connection closes. Performs cleanup and removes the subscriber from the group.
member.param: The unique subscriber ID from Subscribe()

member.name: M:StateleSSE.Abstractions.ISseBackplane.PublishToGroup(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Publish an event to all subscribers in a specific group across all server instances.
member.param: The group identifier to publish to

member.name: M:StateleSSE.Abstractions.ISseBackplane.PublishToGroups(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.Object)
member.summary: Publish an event to multiple groups simultaneously across all server instances. More efficient than calling PublishToGroup() multiple times.

member.name: M:StateleSSE.Abstractions.ISseBackplane.PublishToAll(System.Object)
member.summary: Broadcast an event to all groups and all subscribers across all server instances.

member.name: M:StateleSSE.Abstractions.ISseBackplane.GetLocalSubscriberCount(System.String)
member.summary: Get the number of local subscribers for a specific group on this server instance.

member.name: M:StateleSSE.Abstractions.ISseBackplane.GetLocalGroups
member.summary: Get all group IDs that have active subscribers on this server instance.

member.name: M:StateleSSE.Abstractions.ISseBackplane.GetDiagnostics
member.summary: Get diagnostic information about the backplane state on this server instance. Useful for monitoring and debugging.

member.name: T:StateleSSE.Abstractions.BackplaneDiagnostics
member.summary: Diagnostic information about backplane state on a server instance.

member.name: P:StateleSSE.Abstractions.BackplaneDiagnostics.TotalGroups
member.summary: Total number of groups with active subscribers on this server

member.name: P:StateleSSE.Abstractions.BackplaneDiagnostics.TotalLocalSubscribers
member.summary: Total number of local subscribers across all groups on this server

member.name: P:StateleSSE.Abstractions.BackplaneDiagnostics.Groups
member.summary: Detailed information about each group

member.name: T:StateleSSE.Abstractions.GroupInfo
member.summary: Information about a specific group on this server instance.

member.name: P:StateleSSE.Abstractions.GroupInfo.GroupId
member.summary: The group identifier

member.name: P:StateleSSE.Abstractions.GroupInfo.LocalSubscribers
member.summary: Number of local subscribers in this group on this server

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.ExperimentalAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that an API is experimental and it may change in the future.
member.remarks: This attribute allows call sites to be flagged with a diagnostic that indicates that an experimental feature is used. Authors can use this attribute to ship preview features in their assemblies.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.ExperimentalAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, specifying the ID that the compiler will use when reporting a use of the API the attribute applies to.
member.param: The ID that the compiler will use when reporting a use of the API the attribute applies to.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.ExperimentalAttribute.DiagnosticId
member.summary: Gets the ID that the compiler will use when reporting a use of the API the attribute applies to.
member.remarks:
The diagnostic ID is shown in build output for warnings and errors.
This property represents the unique ID that can be used to suppress the warnings or errors, if needed.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.ExperimentalAttribute.UrlFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the URL for corresponding documentation. The API accepts a format string instead of an actual URL, creating a generic URL that includes the diagnostic ID.
member.value: The format string that represents a URL to corresponding documentation.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.SetsRequiredMembersAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that this constructor sets all required members for the current type, and callers do not need to set any required members themselves.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.StringSyntaxAttribute
member.summary: Specifies the syntax used in a string.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.StringSyntaxAttribute.#ctor(System.String,System.Object[])

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.StringSyntaxAttribute.Arguments

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.UnscopedRefAttribute
member.summary: Used to indicate a byref escapes and is not scoped.

remarks.para: There are several cases where the C# compiler treats a as implicitly - where the compiler does not allow the to escape the method.

For example:
for instance methods.
parameters that refer to types.
parameters.
This attribute is used in those instances where the should be allowed to escape.

Applying this attribute, in any form, has impact on consumers of the applicable API. It is necessary for API authors to understand the lifetime implications of applying this attribute and how it may impact their users.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CollectionBuilderAttribute.#ctor(System.Type,System.String)
member.summary: Initialize the attribute to refer to the method on the type.
member.param: The type of the builder to use to construct the collection.
The name of the method on the builder to use to construct the collection.
member.remarks: must refer to a static method that accepts a single parameter of type and returns an instance of the collection being built containing a copy of the data from that span. In future releases of .NET, additional patterns may be supported.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CollectionBuilderAttribute.BuilderType
member.summary: Gets the type of the builder to use to construct the collection.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CollectionBuilderAttribute.MethodName
member.summary: Gets the name of the method on the builder to use to construct the collection.
member.remarks: This should match the metadata name of the target method. For example, this might be ".ctor" if targeting the type's constructor.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CompilerFeatureRequiredAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that compiler support for a particular feature is required for the location where this attribute is applied.

member.summary: Creates a new instance of the type.
member.param: The name of the feature to indicate.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CompilerFeatureRequiredAttribute.FeatureName
member.summary: The name of the compiler feature.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CompilerFeatureRequiredAttribute.IsOptional
member.summary: If true, the compiler can choose to allow access to the location where this attribute is applied if it does not understand .

member.name: F:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CompilerFeatureRequiredAttribute.RefStructs
member.summary: The used for the ref structs C# feature.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CompilerFeatureRequiredAttribute.RequiredMembers
member.summary: The used for the required members C# feature.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.RequiredMemberAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that a type has required members or that a member is required.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.RequiresLocationAttribute
member.summary: Reserved for use by a compiler for tracking metadata. This attribute should not be used by developers in source code.
